generalInfo:
Colombia, few people do realize that Colombia has everything you can imagine of Latin America hidden in one country, and that nowadays it is a safe country to explore. It has the highest potential for an absolutely amazing holiday of whole South America, it has the Caribbean coast, absorbed African culture and rainforest, the Pacific coast, intact indigenous peoples with their traditions, the Andes in three mountain chains, the coffee zone, active and sleeping volcanoes, high mountains with glaciers, paramo’s, flat lands with cowboys, cattle and abundant wildlife as in the Brazilian Pantanal, the huge vastness of the Amazon rainforest with waterfalls that can compete with the Iguazu waterfalls, abundant birdlife, colonial history & villages, arts & handicrafts representing the variety of many countries in one, salsa, African mapale, vallenato and cumbia (and not to forget the Colombian reggaeton at the Caribbean): the only risk of this holiday is wanting to stay, el riesgo es que te quieres quedar ! The people of Colombia belong to the most welcoming, beautiful and warm hearted people of Latin America, many people won’t be able to match this with the image they have from Colombia, but it really is, be invited to explore this amazing country and its people with us.

This individual holiday of 27 days is a sample itinery and can be tailor made in all ways. We have chosen for a larger itinery of 27 days to show the variety of Colombia in one single roundtrip. We can make shorter itineries, more focused on culture, special theme travels as for bird watchers, photographers or beach lovers, family holidays with kids, all as you wish. We do work on tailor made basis but we can also offer travel modules of three or more days and classical roundtrips. All itineries are offered with private taxis as a standard. For traveling with public transport we need to check with our team in Bogota where this is safe and possible. For traveling with public transport you need to speak good Spanish and be an experienced traveller. Traveling with private taxis is expensive of course but the safest and most confortable way with photo stops along the way. With private transport the trip costs can be significant lower when you are able to travel as a small travelparty of eg 4 persons together.

To give an idea of more options in Colombia:
- Walking, hiking and/or horseriding in the NP Cocuy, high Andes mountains (5-7 days)
- Walking at Los Nevados NP between volcanoes, lagoons, paramos and glaciers (from day excursion, 3 day Paramillo trekking to valley Salento, to 2/3 ascent summit Santa Isabel and 5 days hiking program to top Nevado Tolioma), as long there is no high eruption risk and the NP is open
- Extension to La Guajira desert and Caribbean coast after eg Cartagena, Santa Marta, Tayrona NP (4 days), as group excursion or with private driver-guide in 4x4, Wayuu indigenous culture
- Trekking to the Lost City (Ciudad Perdida) at the Sierra Nevada and/or meeting of Kogui culture in the mountains (5 days)
- Meeting with the Tayrona Kogui - Arhuaco culture before or after a visit to the NP Tayrona (4 days authentic program)
- Wildlife in los Llanos – Casanares province at ecolodge Hato Aurora (filmed by BCC & Animal Planet), with capybaras, 325 bird species, caimans, deers, anacondas of 7m long, jaguars, safaris, piranha fishing, walking and horse riding, traditional life of vagueros - Colombian cowboys & cattle farming
- Visit Cano Cristales, beautiful coloured river famous from photography books, from Yopal-Villaviciencia this can be combined by small plane after a stay at the hacienda Hato Aurora for instance
- Staying at authentic coffee haciendas which are in production
- Special birdwatching tours staying among others in lodges of Pro Aves mixed with other excursions
- Diving holidays and PADI certification via dive school at Cartagena de Indias and/or at Santa Marta
- Luxury Travel at the Caribbean and/or Pacific coast in the best ecolodges available with whale watching and boutique hotels, fincas and spas in the coffee zone and Cartagena, honeymoon at the Caribbean
- Amazon travels: from Bogota to Leticia with Amacayacú National Park, from Villavicencio to Puerto Inírida, the start for the Cerros de Mavicure Amazonas tour, to travel with private guide into the Vaupes region, this is all pristine Amazonian rainforest off the beaten trek with amazing waterfalls and wildlife
- Adventurous and special tailor made travel combining Venezuela’s tepui highlights with traveling upstream into Colombia at Inirida rainforest with private guide
- Private guided roundtravels or Group travels through Colombia with Latin American expert speaking fluent English and Spanish

For the trek to Ciudad Perdida we work with a local partner, it is an all indigenous operated and owned operator, all of their staff is indigenous to the zone and therefore benefit directly from any reservations. During the trek itself, the group is always accompanied by at least one local indigenous guide and a translator and stays in indigenous owned camps. The Wiwa tribe in Colombia’s Sierra Nevada mountains have lived harmoniously with the wildlife surrounding them for thousands of years. Rising approximately 5,000 meters out of Northern Colombia’s Caribbean shores, the misty, cloud-shrouded Sierra Nevada mountains have been the home to several indigenous tribes for more than 2,000 years. As if unaffected by time, the Sierra’s indigenous tribes still live as their Tairona ancestors did centuries ago. Despite growing modernization and tourism in the area, the Wiwa community – the smallest of four tribes living in the Lost City today – show us how they strive to keep their ancient culture alive.

For those who would love to go into the mountains of the Sierra Nevada but wish to avoid a strenuous multiple day trekking, we have also a 4 day very authentic program in another area of the Sierra Nevada where you can visit a village of the Koguis with a 5 hrs walk, eventually with the support of mules for luggage. Rest of transport is with a 4x4 vehicle. The whole program is with a local Kogui guide. It starts in Santa Marta and you will return near NP Tayrona at the beach and is part of a 12 day itinery. You will walk through a subtropical ecosystem and enter the universe of the Koguis. After arriving in the community you will be welcomed and will meet with the local "Mamo". The program for the rest of the afternoon and evening is open, depending on the permissions given by the people of the village. You are guests and therefore the activities depend on the community suggestions. The aim is to interact as much as possible with the indigenous people, and your local Kogui guide will play a major role in this. You will have dinner in the village, and sleep in a hammock in a "Choza" (Kogui hut).

Featured activities: Meeting the authentic Colombia, being in nature, culture & meeting the people of Colombia. Walking in mountains, visiting coffee haciendas, beachlife, colonial villages & history, cumbia & salsa, spa, horse riding, bird & whale watching, snorkelling, diving, learning Spanish.

Then we make use of homestays at Tierradentro, Amazonas, Vaupes & the Coffee zone but in case you are interested in an authentic experience homestays can be requested for whole Colombia. The families speak only Spanish and by making use of their homestay you directly support them.

In case you wish to travel from Colombia into Venezuela we can take care of the whole transfer in a private taxi with guidance from Cucuta airport crossing the border of Cucuta into Venezuela, heading to Bailadores, Tovar and Merida for your holiday. Venezuela is safer than any other country of South America at this moment and we really can recommend it. We offer adventurous hikes with waterfalls and canyoning, daywalks along high mountain lakes, tours by jeeps, birdwatching, wildlife, staying at an authentic coffee farm in the area of Santa Cruz de Mora, from turning inward at multidimensional gates in the Venezuelan Andes, to beach stays at Choroni and los Roques, have a 4 day program at Angel Falls at NP Canaima. For those interested visiting of the Indian tribe of the Yanomami in Venezuela you will be taken with your guide until San Felipe in the deep south of Colombia in front of San Carlos de Rio Negro. And from there with a special permit from the Venezuela military you will travel on the river on to the Yanomani people.

We have more than 190 independent reviews on Responsible Travel on our destinations in Latin America from Cuba, Bolivia, Brasil, Peru, Colombia to Chile and Argentina. Contact us for a chat via Skype and ask for a tailor made itinery and quote.

Shortlist of some important festivals - January: Carnaval de Blancos y Negros in Pasto & Feria de Manizales (coffee zone), February: Carnaval de Barranquilla (of the carnavals highly recommended), March: Easter (Semana Santa) in Popayan, April: Festival de Vallenato in Valledupar, May: the San Pedro and Bunde Tolimense festival in Espinal, Wayuu culture festival in Uribia (La Guajira), June: Bambuco national folk festival in Neiva & festival del Mar in Santa Marta, August: Feria de Flores in Medellin, September: World Salsa festival in Cali, October: the World Coleo Encounter in Villavicencio (cowboy – vaquero festival) , November: Carnaval de Cartagena & Reina National de Belleza (Miss Colombia) in Cartagena de Indias, December: Feria de Cali. For more details on all Colombia festivals, the data and how to add a specific festival in your itinery, please contact us via Whatsapp.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Bogota, welcome and transfer to hotel in Colonial area La Candelaria, hotel Abadia Colonial

City tour Bogota. In the morning guided walk through the colonial area La Candelaria. Main monuments and squares, visit the Gold & Botero Museum, visit Cerro Monserrate , overnight Bogota. Alternative: city tour on bike.

To Laguna de Guatavita for an ecological guided walk to the holy lake of the Muisca Indians, ecosystems of semi-paramo (2800-3100m) and paramo (+3100m). Continuation to the colonial town of Villa de Leyva, overnight in or near the colonial center, hospedería San Carlos.

Free day in Villa de Leyva to explore the colonial town & the surroundings. Optional excursions are: horseback riding, visit to the desert of ‘la Candelaria’, cultural and archeological tour with museums, hike to Parama Iguaque, ecological walks in the surroundings and/or to waterfalls, city tour.
From Villa de Leyva to Barichara, free midday to explore the beautiful colonial town of Barichara on your own. Night in hotel in colonial center, La Nube Posada.
In the morning a guided walk of 3 hrs over the ‘Camino Real’ from Barichara to Guane. In Guane free time before returning to Barichara.

From Barichara to Caño de Chicamocha. Cable car from one side to the other side of the Chicamocha Cañon to ‘Mesa de los Santos’. Continuation to Giron where we will stay in the colonial town, Chill Out Hotel Boutique.
From airport Bucaramanga flight to Neiva. Transfer to the village of Villavieja, hotel Villa Paraiso.

Guided walk in the Tatacoa Dessert in early morning , visiting the sand formations and swim at natural pool. In the afternoon we continue to San Agustin where we stay in a nice hacienda just outside the town, hacienda Anacaona

In the morning visit to the archeological park of San Agustin in company of a local guide. The tour is about 4 hours and we visit the sites Mesa A, B, C and ‘Lavapatos’. We also go to the nearby archeological museum and the ‘Bosque de Estatuas’. Rest of the day free to wander around in the town of San Agustin or to see more of the beautiful surrounding. Second night in San Agustin. Optional midday: 3 to 5 hours horse ride in the surroundings of San Agustin after the visit to the archeological park to see surroundings and some more archeological sites, rafting on the Magdalena River, or a jeep tour in the surroundings.

To Popayan via the paramo and with some views at the Puracé Volcanoe. After arrival in Popayan free afternoon and evening to explore the ‘White Colonial Town’ of Popayan on your own. Night in Popayan close to the main square, hotel la Plazuela.

Free day at Popayan to explore more of the colonial town or the surroundings. Optional: tour to the Paramo de Puracé, the hotsprings of San Juan and spot the largest bird of South America, the Condor.
To Salento, with a possible visit to Silvia and the Indian market depending on the day, hostal Ciudad de Segorbe.

Tour in Willys to Valle de Cocora, ecological walk with a local guide through the valley. This valley is known for its palm trees ‘Palma de Cera’ which can reach heights of 70m. On our way back we will visit a local coffee farmer to learn a little bit about the local coffee process. Optional horseback ride instead of hike in Valle de Cocora.

From Salento to hacienda Venecia. This is a large operating coffee farm where we will stay in the traditional and very beautiful coffee hacienda with stunning views over the coffee fields. In the afternoon we get an explanation about the coffee process. Difference with the former coffee tour is that this farm produces not only for self sustaining, but for consumption in Colombia and export as well, you stay in the traditional coffee finca Venecia (not in the hostel).

From airport Pereira flight to Nuqui via the town of Quibdo in the department of Choco. After arrival at Nuqui short boat ride over the sea to the accommodation at the beach of the village Termales, Posada Mar y Rio (can also be upgraded).

Stay at Posada Turistica Mar y Rio. Inclusive are 3 meals a day, ecological walk to hotsprings and a little waterfall. During the months of June (end) till October (beginning) you can see the whales passing by. Boat trips to see the amazing whales closer can be included. Other activities are fishing, boat trips, hikes and ecological walks in the Pacific rainforest.

Boat back to Nuqui and flight to Medellin, boutique hotel in the modern area called ‘El Poblado’. In the afternoon a short city tour with visit to the center of Medellin, Botero, a ride in the metro and metro cable to the neighborhood of Santa Domingo, optional visit to street children project.

From airport Medellin direct flight to Santa Marta, from here to NP Tayrona. From the entrance of the NP Tayrona walk for 45 minutes through the jungle to the sector of Arrecifes where we will stay in cabins in the park and close to the beach of Arrecifes. As an option we can also stay in the very luxury ecohabs close to the entrance of the Tayrona Park. These ecohabs are located on the jungle hills of the Tayrona Park overlooking the sea, Cabañas Arrecifes, or upgrade to Ecohabs.

Free days in the Tayrona Park to relax, to enjoy the many beaches or to make some hikes in the park. There is a hike of 4 to 5 hours (return) from Arrecifes to the Archeological site of ‘el Pueblito’. These terraces are from to former Indian culture of the Tayronas. Optional hike can be arranged with the reception of the cabins, with the local guides in the park or be done on your own.

Walk back to the entrance of the Tayrona Park and to Cartagena. In Cartagena we will stay in the colonial town of the walled city in the area called ‘San Diego’. Late afternoon and evening free to explore the colonial town, hotel 3 Banderas. On the way to Cartagena a stop can be made in case of private transfer at the mud volcano Totumo for a very special mudbath and swim in the river.

City tour Cartagena de Indias in the morning, guided walk through the colonial town visiting the neighbourhoods of San Diego, Calamari and Gestemani, walk over the old city wall. Rest of the day free to explore more of the city and her surroundings by yourself. Optional extension in afternoon visiting the ‘Castillo San Felipe de Barajas’ (fortress) and the convent of ‘Cerro de la Popa’.

Free day in Cartagena. The hotel of 3 Banderas also has accommodation on the island of ‘Tierra Bomba’ on the beach in front of the modern area of ‘Bocagrande’. In coordination with the reception you can switch one night in the colonial town for one night in the beach hotel. Optional: a tour on this free day to Islas del Rosario, Playa Blanca, Volcan de Totumo, visiting a social children project with mangrove tour at Boquilla, tour to African village of Palenque, etc.

To airport of Cartagena and international flight back home. Holiday extensions can be made eg to Mompox, for colonial culture, history and silver handicrafts, to Monteria for staying at a traditional cattle farm, to La Guajira (in combination with Tayrona Park) for desert, Caribbean beaches and Wayuu indigenous culture.
